SENT.plain: A confirmed case of American Burkitt's lymphoma with jaw involvement in a 12-year-old Caucasian girl from western Pennsylvania is described
There were clinical manifestations in the mandibular quadrants and radiographic manifestations in all mandibular and maxillary quadrants
One of the earliest clinical manifestations of the lymphoma in the mandible was observed by a family dentist
The lymphoma later produced a deterioration of the overlying mandibular mucosa, moderate expansion of the cortex of the mandible, and paresthesia of the lip with probable V3 involvement
Four months after the first admission there were radiographic manifestations of the lymphoma in both the maxillary and mandibular quadrants
Early diagnosis and appropriate management may improve the prognosis
